attributes.name: report_text
attributes.value: Owing to the significant deterioration of mental functions impacting his cognitive and volitional faculties [and that] from the perspective of testifying at a hearing, the patient does not possess the necessary capacity in relation to memory, calculation, mental focus, deliberative critical thinking and abstract thinking, as well as other cognitive functions which are needed to give correct answers to the questions put to him, nor can he properly perform the mental functions essential to his defence.

attributes.name: purpose

attributes.name: summary
attributes.value: a defendant with partial incapacity as a result of a mental illness is able to be present during the criminal proceedings but might need some assistance despite representation by a lawyer in order to understand the process and defend properly

attributes.name: role
attributes.value: person in charge of the paperwork

attributes.name: legal_text
attributes.value: Compliance with the requirements of a fair trial must be examined in each case having regard to the development of the proceedings as a whole and not on the basis of an isolated consideration of one particular aspect or one particular incident, although it cannot be ruled out that a specific factor may be so decisive as to enable the fairness of the trial to be assessed at an earlier stage in the proceedings

attributes.name: purpose
attributes.value: The fundamental purpose of this report is to highlight the shortcomings, defects and imbalances in the treatment of persons with mental disorders in the Spanish criminal justice system, highlighting the tensions between the explicit legal model contained in the Criminal Procedure Law and the implicit model of fair or due process proposed by the 1978 Constitution

attributes.name: summary
attributes.value: model of fair or due process

attributes.name: full_text
attributes.value: In conclusion, the Spanish legal system is still very far6 from ensuring the required level of positive obligations to protect persons with a mental disability in criminal proceedings, as guaranteed by the Convention7 (see paragraph 59 of the present judgment):

attributes.name: full_text
attributes.value: It means that he or she, if necessary, with the assistance of, for example, an interpreter, lawyer, social worker or friend, should be able to understand the general thrust of what is said in court. The defendant should be able to follow what is said by the prosecution witnesses and, if represented, to explain to his own lawyers his version of events, point out any statements with which he disagrees and make them aware of any facts which should be put forward in his defence (ibid., ¶ 29)

attributes.name: process_description
attributes.value: request for the termination of criminal proceedings

attributes.name: process_description
attributes.value: asking for special measures to be put in place during the trial to assist someone who has mental or communication difficulties

attributes.name: description
attributes.value: proceedings involving persons with disabilities or elderly persons

attributes.name: full_text
attributes.value: the domestic courts were not called on to offer them or provide them of their own motion

attributes.name: full_text
attributes.value: ...the Court observes that the applicant did not substantiate, either before the domestic courts or before the Court, any specific impact of the lack of adjustment measures on the overall fairness of the trial ..

attributes.name: report_text
attributes.value: various forensic reports analysing the applicant's situation

attributes.name: consequence_assessment_summary
attributes.value: The defendant has to be able to understand the consequences of exercising the right to give evidence or using the opportunity to speak at the end of the trial

attributes.name: complaint_text

attributes.name: commitment_description

attributes.name: other_measure_description

attributes.name: applicant_statement_no_alleged_influence_or_prevention
attributes.value: The applicant has not suggested that the absence of procedural adjustments, such as the assistance of another person or the opportunity to testify via video-link, in any way influenced his decision to exercise his right to silence or prevented or discouraged him from giving evidence in his defence.

attributes.name: actions_requested
attributes.value: admit new evidence related to the applicant's capacity; call a number of experts to the hearing; order a psychiatric expert report; request the applicant's release

attributes.name: request_condition
attributes.value: in the event that the court did not order the discontinuation of the proceedings as previously requested

attributes.name: assessment_summary
attributes.value: assess whether the applicant's mental health condition, without reaching a level of impairment warranting the discontinuation of the proceedings, called for other procedural adjustments on the part of the domestic authorities in order to ensure his effective participation

attributes.name: fairness_assessment_outcome
attributes.value: assess whether, in the absence of such adjustments, the criminal proceedings against the applicant, taken as a whole, could be considered as unfair

attributes.name: quoted_legal_provision
attributes.value: The guardianship of incapacitated persons shall have as its purpose the guardian's assistance in those acts expressly referred to in the judgment that established the guardianship.

attributes.name: legal_article_reference
attributes.value: Furthermore Article 290 of the same Criminal Code states:

attributes.name: appeal_type
attributes.value: recurso de casaci�n (appeal on points of law)

attributes.name: appeal_reason
attributes.value: the refusal to admit some of the medical reports had amounted to a violation of his right of access to justice and to prepare his defence

attributes.name: legal_framework_text
attributes.value: There is a detailed statutory framework for special measures for victims.

attributes.name: exclusion_reason
attributes.value: Defendants have not been included in this framework.

attributes.name: legislative_basis_and_limitations_description
attributes.value: The basic legislative framework for victims who require special measures is Section 14 of the Criminal Evidence Act 1992 as amended (intermediaries) and Section 13; the legislation limits the use of special measures to particular types of case (essentially sexual and violent crimes).

attributes.name: possible_actions_note
attributes.value: Court might order special measures for victims under its 'inherent jurisdiction' if necessary.

attributes.name: replacement_statement_text
attributes.value: should be replaced by the Aldaba Foundation, stating that its functions would have the same scope and limits as those set in the judgment of 11 October 2016.

attributes.name: reiterated_text
attributes.value: The Court reiterates that the purpose of the requirement of exhaustion of domestic remedies is to afford the Contracting States the opportunity of preventing or putting right — usually through the courts — the violations alleged against them before those allegations are submitted to the Court

attributes.name: judgment_result
attributes.value: the impact of the applicant's incapacity in the pending criminal proceedings against him had been a matter to be determined in the framework of those proceedings

attributes.name: official_statement_text
attributes.value: the applicant had only been placed under partial guardianship; he would be assisted by a third party for some actions but that did not imply that he would be represented by that person

attributes.name: attendance_guarantee

attributes.name: report_conclusion
attributes.value: The applicant suffered from the effects of an attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) present since childhood, and a personality disorder with schizoid and compulsive features.

attributes.name: requested_proceeding_type
attributes.value: initiate civil proceedings for the applicant's incapacitation

attributes.name: continuation_reason
attributes.value: had continued to act as guardian until his resignation had been formally accepted

attributes.name: reason_guardian_unnecessary
attributes.value: forensic reports and the incapacity judgment

attributes.name: recognized_text
attributes.value: The Court further notes that the issue of the applicant's mental health condition was raised before the domestic authorities on several occasions. While it is true that the applicant's allegations were focused on stressing that he could not stand trial and that the proceedings should be discontinued, the various documents submitted in support of that request did refer to a history of several mental health disorders and to the deterioration of his cognitive faculties

attributes.name: submission_comment
attributes.value: the various documents submitted in support of that request did refer to a history of several mental health disorders and to the deterioration of his cognitive faculties

attributes.name: acceptance_statement
attributes.value: States had a wide discretion as regards the means to ensure that their legal systems were in compliance with the requirements of Article 6 of the Convention.

attributes.name: referral_note
attributes.value: In his view, in the Spanish domestic system, the relevant safeguards in that connection were provided by Article 383 of the Criminal Procedure Act and Article 101 of the Criminal Code and referred to the Supreme Court's case law in that regard.

attributes.name: decision_text
attributes.value: The circumstances of a case may require the Contracting States to take positive measures in order to enable the applicant to participate effectively in the proceedings.

attributes.name: assistance_components
attributes.value: interpretation in sign languages legally recognised; support for the verbal communication of deaf people, people with a hearing disability and deafblind people

attributes.name: intended_recipients
attributes.value: deaf people; people with a hearing disability; deafblind people

attributes.name: participation_reason
attributes.value: allow a person with a disability to understand and be understood

attributes.name: adjournment_reason
attributes.value: neither the applicant nor the representative of one of the other parties were present

attributes.name: examination_reason
attributes.value: evaluate the applicant's cognitive and volitional capacity; the origins and consequences of his disorders; and whether he had sufficient capacity to stand trial and to understand the scope and consequences of the trial and his statements

attributes.name: affirmation_scope
attributes.value: every step that may be taken

attributes.name: determination_outcome
attributes.value: Applicant able to understand the scope of the proceedings and to stand trial; discontinuing the proceedings under Articles 381 to 384 was inappropriate

attributes.name: admissibility_rationale
attributes.value: request was made out of time

attributes.name: evidence_likelihood
attributes.value: possible to propose new evidence at the beginning of the hearing

attributes.name: lack_of_knowledge_statement
attributes.value: I don't have any idea about anything.

attributes.name: observation_text
attributes.value: The Court observes that the requests were duly addressed by the domestic courts and that the courts requested two additional forensic reports, paying full attention to the assertions of diminished mental capacity

attributes.name: intent_prompt
attributes.value: Asked if he intended to reply to the questions put forward by the other parties

attributes.name: response_text
attributes.value: I cannot reply because I don't know

attributes.name: intent_prompt
attributes.value: Asked again if he intended to reply to the questions

attributes.name: response_text
attributes.value: It's not that I don't want [to reply], but I can't

events.type: Make accommodation by court on its own motion
Make accommodation by court on its own motion

attributes.name: suspension_reason
attributes.value: The applicant could not understand the administrative concepts related to the facts of which he had been accused; the defence had been severely affected by his cognitive impairment, his difficulties in understanding the documents, and the lack of cooperation from the lawyers who had previously represented the applicant.

attributes.name: legal_holding
attributes.value: failure to notify the agent of the hearing date renders the proceeding null and void (as cited)

attributes.name: legal_holding
attributes.value: a judgment that ignores the obligation to provide information when it has not been effective is subject to cassation (as cited)

attributes.name: provision_applicability
attributes.value: This Code is, however, applicable in criminal proceedings only in the absence of specific provisions in the Criminal Procedure Act.

attributes.name: proposed_provision_text
attributes.value: In order for the concept of procedural adjustments for vulnerable persons to be effectively applied in practice, it might be necessary to introduce a specific provision into the Criminal Procedure Act and the Criminal Code.

attributes.name: experience_description
attributes.value: Spain has little experience of making accommodations and adjustments in criminal trials for defendants with partial incapacity.

attributes.name: guardianshipScopeReference
attributes.value: Articles 259 to 275 of the Civil Code

attributes.name: court_note_text
attributes.value: The Court further notes that the applicant's conviction was based on several pieces of evidence and takes into account the significant weight given to the documentary evidence (see paragraphs 28-29 above), in view of the financial and technical aspects involved in tax-related offences.

attributes.name: referenced_paragraph_text
attributes.value: The Spanish system must be improved and develop more clearly the positive measures required (see paragraph 64 of the present judgment): to enable the persons involved to participate effectively in the proceedings (see paragraph 59 above). This positive obligation includes, where needed, the provision of procedural adjustments for persons who, due to an impairment of their mental faculties, are not fully capable of acting for themselves (see paragraph 58 above).

attributes.name: provision_text
attributes.value: The law shall determine the cases in which, for reasons of family relationship or professional secrecy, it shall not be compulsory to make statements regarding alleged criminal offences.

events.type: Note judgment does not specify acts

attributes.name: reason_for_unspecified_acts
attributes.value: Judgment on incapacitation has not specified the acts for which the intervention of the guardian should be necessary.

attributes.name: extension_reason
attributes.value: Intervention of the guardian shall be deemed to extend to the same acts for which guardians require judicial authorisation, in accordance with this Code.

attributes.name: allegation_description
attributes.value: ALLEGED VIOLATION OF ARTICLE 6 OF THE CONVENTION

attributes.name: intervention_description
attributes.value: Les articles 706-112 et suivants du Code de procédure pénale viennent ainsi prévoir l'intervention de ces mêmes personnes.

attributes.name: role_adjustment_reason
attributes.value: en adaptant cependant leur rôle aux finalités du procès pénal

attributes.name: non_observance_reason
attributes.value: non-observance of the adjustments indicated in the forensic report

attributes.name: amendment_description
attributes.value: In 2021 legislative amendments reinforcing the procedural rights of elderly persons and persons with disabilities were adopted in Spain.

attributes.name: amendment_description
attributes.value: In 2023 legislative amendments reinforcing the procedural rights of elderly persons and persons with disabilities were adopted in Spain.

attributes.name: request_reason
attributes.value: The applicant's lawyer asked the Audiencia Provincial to discontinue the criminal proceedings, in accordance with Article 383 of the Criminal Procedure Act.

attributes.value: on reforming civil and procedural legislation to support persons with disabilities in exercising their legal capacity

relationships.objectId: Ciutadella de Menorca Court of First Instance No. 1

attributes.name: issue_description
attributes.value: Forensic expert issued a second report on the applicant's condition noting history of mental illnesses (attention deficit hyperactivity disorder, personality disorder, cognitive impairment), absence of medical reports confirming origins and development, and that the applicant could identify the difference between right and wrong and act accordingly.

events.type: Note no claim raised on appeal

attributes.name: Unraised claim description
attributes.value: did not claim that non-participation in the hearing via videolink or the guardian's absence had negatively affected his defence

attributes.name: note_text
attributes.value: there is no provision for a situation where a defendant with partial incapacity as a result of a mental illness is able to be present during the criminal proceedings but, notwithstanding his or her representation by a lawyer, might need some assistance in order to be able to understand the process and defend himself or herself properly

attributes.name: decision_text
attributes.value: The Supreme Court dismissed the appeal and upheld the judgment of the Audiencia Provincial, endorsing its conclusions concerning the applicant's capacity to stand trial.

attributes.name: presenting_symptoms
attributes.value: showed symptoms of a psychotic disorder

attributes.value: faced 'ups and downs' to complete his engineering degree

attributes.name: administrative_functioning
attributes.value: he had been unable to manage the paperwork

attributes.name: presenting_symptoms
attributes.value: showed symptoms of a psychotic disorder

attributes.name: target_state
attributes.value: not to leave a 'vulnerable' person alone at their trial

attributes.name: judgmentDecisionSummary
attributes.value: Give notice to the Spanish Government of the complaints under Article 6 §§ 1 and 3 (b) of the Convention; declare the remainder inadmissible; decision not to disclose the applicant's name

attributes.name: allegation_text
attributes.value: Applicant alleged he could not stand trial and that the proceedings should be discontinued

attributes.name: submission_comment
attributes.value: Various documents were submitted in support of the request and referred to a history of mental health disorders and deterioration of cognitive faculties

attributes.value: the applicant had not argued in which way his defence had been negatively affected

attributes.value: the applicant had had ample opportunity to access the file and prepare his defence

attributes.name: silence_reason
attributes.value: the applicant had remained silent during the hearings

attributes.name: prohibited_inference_description
attributes.value: without that resulting in any negative inferences against him

attributes.name: no_allegation_reason

attributes.value: Lawyers assisting the applicant were fully in a position to assess the need for requesting adjustment measures and to specify their nature

events.type: Make accommodations by court on its own motion
Make accommodations by court on its own motion

attributes.name: resolution_notes
attributes.value: determine whether this decision may impact the criminal cases; to be decided case-by-case

attributes.name: allegation_text
attributes.value: The applicant alleged that the right to adequately prepare one's defence comprises the effective communication between the accused and the lawyer and the ability of the accused to understand and answer the questions concerning the accusations. It was therefore impossible to have an adequate defence in situations where the accused suffered from a cognitive impairment preventing him from understanding the charges and from properly answering the relevant questions put to him or her.

attributes.name: request_reason
attributes.value: applicant's lawyer requested that the proceedings be discontinued

attributes.name: supporting_document_reference
attributes.value: see paragraphs 43 and 66 of the present judgment

attributes.name: provision_applicability
attributes.value: criminal procedure does not clearly provide for the possibility for lawyers to request procedural adjustments

events.type: Apply rule deeming guardian intervention extended

attributes.name: deeming_rule_condition
attributes.value: judgment on incapacitation has not specified the acts for which the intervention of the guardian should be necessary

attributes.name: deeming_rule_action
attributes.value: such intervention shall be deemed to extend to the same acts for which guardians require judicial authorisation

attributes.name: rejection_reason
attributes.value: court stated that it was unnecessary to order a new forensic report as there had already been two previous forensic reports assessing the applicant's capacity.

attributes.name: issue_description
attributes.value: The issue to be determined in the instant case is whether the manner in which the proceedings were conducted in relation to the applicant guaranteed him effective enjoyment of the right to a fair hearing and enabled him to exercise his defence rights and to effectively participate in the proceedings.

attributes.name: reason_for_reporting
attributes.value: request discontinuation of the proceedings on that ground

attributes.name: judgment_finding
attributes.value: practical impossibility of appealing in the context of compulsory hospitalization

attributes.name: judgment_finding
attributes.value: non-violation of 6 (precautions taken for the preparation of the appearance before the assize court, examination of the capacity to defend oneself and to appear)

attributes.name: statement_text
attributes.value: The Court has also stated that special procedural safeguards may prove called for in order to protect the interests of persons who, on account of their mental disabilities, are not fully capable of acting for themselves

attributes.name: reference_text
attributes.value: ... With regard to the recurring question of Mr [F.S.M.]�s incapacity ..

attributes.name: note_rule_description
attributes.value: The relevant rule, as in force since March 2024, reads as follows: Article 7 bis.

attributes.name: legal_holding
attributes.value: Delay in providing information does not necessarily constitute a grievance; the protected adult must establish that the failure to provide information by the curator has harmed his or her interests if he or she intends to rely on nullity.

attributes.name: claims
attributes.value: the conclusions of the forensic reports of June and October 2018 called for additional evidence to verify his mental health condition, particularly in view of the time that had elapsed between the reports requested by the Audiencia Provincial and those submitted by the applicant.

attributes.name: case_description
attributes.value: It was a case of a person with pretty severe mental problems (arising from head injuries) who was a defendant.

attributes.name: hospital_statement_document_id
attributes.value: the applicant had been voluntarily admitted to hospital between 1 and 14 June 2018 because he had been having thoughts of self-harm

attributes.name: proposal_description
attributes.value: implicit model of fair or due process

attributes.name: requestReason
attributes.value: verify whether the applicant understood the charges and the scope of the criminal proceedings

attributes.name: legal_basis_reference
attributes.value: Rule 77 2 and 3 of the Rules of Court

attributes.name: reference_to_legal_or_contract_provision
attributes.value: Article 45 2 of the Convention and Rule 74 2 of the Rules of Court

attributes.name: referenced_paragraph_text
attributes.value: In conclusion, the Spanish legal system is still very far6 from ensuring the required level of positive obligations to protect persons with a mental disability in criminal proceedings, as guaranteed by the Convention7 (see paragraph 59 of the present judgment):

attributes.name: court_finding_summary
attributes.value: The applicant has not suggested that the absence of procedural adjustments, such as the assistance of another person or the opportunity to testify via video-link, in any way influenced his decision to exercise his right to silence or prevented or discouraged him from giving evidence in his defence.

events.type: Record judge's observation of diminished mental capacity

attributes.name: forensic_exam_location_type
attributes.value: establishment in which defendant is imprisoned or another public establishment if more convenient or if at liberty

attributes.name: report_issuance_method
attributes.value: set forth in Chapter VII of this Title

attributes.name: recommended_measures
attributes.value: measures needed to preserve his right to defend himself

attributes.name: holding_text
attributes.value: Additionally, the Court has held that in cases concerning serious charges against persons whose mental faculties are impaired, the national authorities have to take additional steps in the interests of the proper administration of justice.

attributes.name: quoted_text
attributes.value: Lastly, it should be pointed out that the person with allegedly diminished capacity, Mr. F.S.M., is under investigation in several preliminary proceedings, of which this court is aware owing to the distribution of criminal cases

attributes.name: capacity_evidence_document_id
attributes.value: statements made in his closing statement

attributes.name: assessment_outcome
attributes.value: appellant in a position to exercise his defence rights effectively

events.type: Claim failure to exhaust domestic remedies

attributes.name: hearing_purpose
attributes.value: the applicant's capacity to understand the implications of the trial and the accusation against him

attributes.name: verbal_report_conclusion
attributes.value: the applicant's mental health condition was not so serious as to impede him from understanding the purpose of the trial and its implications

attributes.name: assessment_outcome
attributes.value: assessed the conclusions of those reports

attributes.name: refusal_reason
attributes.value: gave appropriate reasons to refuse the additional forensic evidence

attributes.name: compliance_verdict
attributes.value: those steps were sufficient to comply with Articles 381 and 383 of the Criminal Procedure Act

attributes.name: state_name
attributes.value: the domestic courts were not called on to offer them or provide them of their own motion

attributes.name: final_quote_amount
attributes.value: ...the Court observes that the applicant did not substantiate, either before the domestic courts or before the Court, any specific impact of the lack of adjustment measures on the overall fairness of the trial ..

attributes.name: examination_notes
attributes.value: The Court reiterates that the requirements of paragraph 3 of Article 6 are to be seen as particular aspects of the right to a fair trial guaranteed by paragraph 1; accordingly, the Court will examine the complaint under those two provisions taken together (see, among other authorities, F.C.B. v. Italy, 28 August 1991, �a7 29, Series A no. 208-B; Vaudelle v. France, no. 35683/97, �a7 35, ECHR 2001-I; and Bogdan v. Ukraine, no. 3016/16, �a7 32, 8 February 2024).

attributes.name: observation_text
attributes.value: The Court sees no reason to depart from the domestic court's conclusions concerning the possible discontinuation of the proceedings on account of the applicant's mental health condition. It observes in this regard that none of the various forensic reports analysing the applicant's situation found him unfit to stand trial or unable to understand the scope and purpose of the proceedings.

attributes.name: argumentText
attributes.value: The Government argued that the application should be declared partly inadmissible owing to non-exhaustion of domestic remedies. The applicant's complaints concerning the alleged difficulties in preparing his defence as a result of his condition had not been adequately raised as a separate complaint in the amparo-appeal before the Constitutional Court.

attributes.name: referral_reason
attributes.value: for them to be examined on the merits

attributes.name: document_reference
attributes.value: auto de apertura del juicio oral

attributes.name: observation_text
attributes.value: en procédure civile plusieurs mécanismes de représentation permettent à des incapables, même majeurs, de faire valoir leurs droits en justice grâce à l'intervention d'un tuteur ou à l'assistance d'un curateur
